Context:
Peer Mentor+ offers on-campus and off-campus supports to serve students better, with goals of increasing student mental health, resiliency, and inclusion. Urgent resources can be found on their Urgent Resources page, and one-on-one student peer support is available at https://14908.waitwell.ca/. They offer inclusion programs where students can learn ASL basics and Deaf culture, as well as wellness programs for one-on-one support, life skill development, and meeting other GBC students. Interested individuals can sign up to be kept in the loop about application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours, and more by signing up now. Their contact information is 416-415-2000 for regular calls and 1-877-515-5559 for TTY, with emails at ask.george@georgebrown.ca. Their social media hub can be visited for more information. The website's contents are subject to change without notice and should not be viewed as a representation, offer or warranty. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.

Entities: Peer Mentor+, Urgent Resources page, https://14908.waitwell.ca/, inclusion programs, wellness programs, sign up now, George Brown College, regular calls, TTY, 1-877-515-5559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca, social media hub.

Numbers: 416-415-2000, 1-877-515-5559
